passage_text: Average Music Major Salaries. The average salary for music major jobs is $48,000. Average music major salaries can vary greatly due to company, location, industry, experience and benefits. This salary was calculated using the average salary for all jobs with the term music major anywhere in the job listing. Music Major Salary Information. This free salary calculator uses salary data from millions of job listings indexed by Simply Hired's job search engine. The music major salary comparisons feature allows job seekers to get the information required to make important career decisions and negotiate salary ranges.

MUSIC THERAPIST. Career Overview: A Music Therapist works with clients to improve any issues with their emotional, physical, cognitive and social wellbeing through the use of music lessons, sing-a-longs, etc. Average Annual Earnings: $50,000. General Earnings Range: $20,000–$135,000.

National Music Major Salary Information. The average yearly salary for Music Major is $36,550. If you are just beginning to work a new job as a Music Major, you could expect a starting pay rate of $30,100 annually.

Basics. The median pay of business management and administration undergraduates was $58,000 per year in 2011, according to Georgetown University. The 25th percentile earned $40,000 per year and the 75th percentile earned $85,000 per year, a difference of more than double the lower salary.

Starting Salaries. A survey conducted by the National Association of Colleges and Employers found that music education majors earned an average starting salary of $36,400 a year as of 2012. This figure, however, doesn’t account for occupation. Your line of work has a direct impact on your earnings.
